en_title: Secretary for Justice to visit Bangkok

en: The Secretary for Justice, Mr Rimsky Yuen, SC, will lead a delegation of legal and dispute resolution professionals to visit Bangkok, Thailand, from October 5 to 7 to promote Hong Kong's international legal and dispute resolution services. He will also attend promotional activities to be held by the Hong Kong Trade Development Council (HKTDC) and the Hong Kong Tourism Board (HKTB).

While in Bangkok, Mr Yuen will officiate at the opening ceremony of "In Style．Hong Kong" organised by the HKTDC and speak at the thematic session on "Legal Risk Management: Key to International Trade and Investment", which is part of the "In Style．Hong Kong" symposium. He will also officiate at the "In Style．Hong Kong" Gala Dinner.
In addition, Mr Yuen will launch "Hong Kong Live in Bangkok" presented by the HKTB to promote Hong Kong tourism experiences.
Mr Yuen and representatives of Hong Kong’s legal and dispute resolution delegation will take the opportunity to meet with relevant Thai officials to exchange views on matters of mutual interest.
He will return to Hong Kong in the evening on October 7.
zh: 律政司司長袁國強資深大律師將於十月五日至七日，率領法律和解決爭議界專業人士代表團訪問泰國曼谷，推廣香港的國際法律和解決爭議服務。袁國強亦會出席香港貿易發展局（貿發局）及香港旅遊發展局（旅發局）舉辦的推廣活動。
律政司司長袁國強資深大律師將於十月五日至七日，率領法律和解決爭議界專業人士代表團訪問泰國曼谷，推廣香港的國際法律和解決爭議服務。袁國強亦會出席香港貿易發展局（貿發局）及香港旅遊發展局（旅發局）舉辦的推廣活動。
在曼谷期間，袁國強將為貿發局主辦的「時尚潮流．魅力香港」主持開幕典禮，並於該活動的高峰論壇的「國際貿易和投資的關鍵：法律風險管理」專題研討會上致辭。他亦會為貿發局舉辦的「香港晚宴」作主禮嘉賓。
此外，袁國強會在旅發局舉辦的推廣活動「香港活現曼谷」主持開幕典禮，推廣香港的旅遊體驗。
袁國強將聯同香港法律和解決爭議界代表與泰國相關官員會面，就雙方關注的議題交流意見。
袁國強將於十月七日晚上返港。

He will also attend promotional activities to be held by the Hong Kong Trade Development Council (HKTDC) and the Hong Kong Tourism Board (HKTB).

While in Bangkok, Mr Yuen will officiate at the opening ceremony of "In Style．Hong Kong" organised by the HKTDC and speak at the thematic session on "Legal Risk Management: Key to International Trade and Investment", which is part of the "In Style．Hong Kong" symposium
He will also officiate at the "In Style．Hong Kong" Gala Dinner.
In addition, Mr Yuen will launch "Hong Kong Live in Bangkok" presented by the HKTB to promote Hong Kong tourism experiences.
Mr Yuen and representatives of Hong Kong’s legal and dispute resolution delegation will take the opportunity to meet with relevant Thai officials to exchange views on matters of mutual interest.
He will return to Hong Kong in the evening on October 7.
